mods.abstract: A collection of songs dealing with science fiction, fantasy, medievalism, sex, computers, etc.
mods.accessCondition: Published February, 1976 by the Hopkins Science Fiction Association. All rights reserved for the contributors. Previous editions published March and May, 1975.
mods.note: Four editions of the HopSFA Hymnal were published, all containing items which were claimed to infringe on copyrights. This edition does state, however: "All songs used by permission."

titleInfo.title: She'll Be Coming Round the Mountain

relatedItem.note: Multiple free translations from the Welsh
The tune obviously goes to either of the common "Drunken Sailor" tunes. "Jonah" may be an alternate title for one of them.

titleInfo.title: The Realio Trulio Last Show Stopper
The Love Song of Lazarus Long
I Want a Girl Just Like the Girl

relatedItem.note: Additional verses by Chuck Rein and others

titleInfo.title: He Said He Was a Pilot on the Liner "Luna May"
The Ballad of Lieutenant Mary Sue
The Klingon Diplomatic Corps Marching Song
titleInfo.subTitle: or Imperialism for Fun and Profit

titleInfo.title: A Quarter Million Sunsets Worth of Lonely
I Could Have Filked All Night
I Could Have Danced All Night
You Can't Be a Klingon in the Federation
Dedicated to the Lizard Leader, Rick Carter
My God, How the Money Rolls In

If I Were a Rich Man

relatedItem.note: "Yang the Nauseating" is a pseudonym of Robert Asprin

titleInfo.title: He's Got a Whole Lot of Crud in His Zine
He's Got the Whole World in His Hands
The Meeting of Yang and Azrael

relatedItem.note: Tune given as "The Horst Wesel (sic) Song," but it's a far better fit to "Tomorrow Belongs to Me" from Cabaret

titleInfo.title: The Song of the Dark Horde

relatedItem.note: I wouldn't be surprised if that's really Murray Porath.

name.namePart: Take Me Out to the Ball Game

titleInfo.title: I See That You're a Mongol

relatedItem.note: Apparently to "Who's Afraid of the Big Bad Wolf?"
Looks a lot like "Marching to Pretoria"
No tune specified, but obviously to "My Favorite Things."
Not to be confused with "What Song Is This?" to the tune of Greensleeves

titleInfo.title: The Vulcan Academy of Science School Cheer
And This Is One of Them

relatedItem.note: No tune specified, but parodies "Wearing of the Green"

Oh, That Lost Sense of Wonder

Look What They've Done to My Song
Look What They've Done to My Song
Thank Ghu I'm a Fannish Boy
Thank God I'm a Country Boy

relatedItem.note: Includes explanatory notes from Anderson's novel "After Doomsday." Could be sung to the same tune as "The Ballad of the Three Kings."
Also known as "The Queen of Air and Darkness"
